posts.text:
Here is the question before us right now:

Are we still a democracy? Or are we a country where everyday people live under the thumb of government power?

🔥Abolish DHS & abolish ICE🔥

We’re attacked w/ continual gaslighting by the regime & fascists in power & by centrist Ds led by Schumer & Jeffries while we're being abducted, stalked, terrorized, brutalized, threatened, & murdered holding the line www.huffpost.com/entry/democr...

Democracy is about the People; and, We the People have not been paying attention to who we place our trust in and elect. It's been going on for a long time. Things start to look like they're getting better and then we get complacent (again). We are the oldest Constitutional Democracy. Stay focused 💙

posts.text:
American trailblazer Rosa Parks was born 113 years ago today. 
 
Rosa Parks took a stand by taking a seat. Her tenacity and bravery helped reignite the Civil Rights Movement. Let us keep up her fight to push our country towards justice for all.

replies.text: May we all do her proud ❤️

Two American heroes in one photo.

Ms. Parks had a kind face…..
Love this photo! It's nice that it includes the gentleman to the left.💙

Her strength is seen as even more admirable as we have witnessed many privileged individuals fail to resist authoritarianism and leave positions of power because they have been threatened even though their physically safety is never in doubt.
I’m so proud to be her cousin!

I commuted from Northeast DC to Montgomery County, MD, and back today. That commute is nothing special, but today, on all six busses and both metro cars, there were signs reserving a seat for Rosa Parks
it was just 70ish years ago she was arrested for not giving up her seat to a white guy. this country's history is so deeply fucked up
